lead_paragraph: The San Diego Padres right-hander Mark Prior said he felt strong after facing live hitters for the first time in a year. Prior, who had shoulder surgery in April while with the Chicago Cubs, threw 25 pitches during an eight-minute session. “It was good,” Prior said. “It was nice to see their reaction to how I’m throwing even though they’re way ahead of me as far as being prepared. It was good to get in there and see where you’re at.” Prior signed a $1 million deal with his hometown Padres in December, with the chance to make more in incentives. He will start the season on the 60-day disabled list and is expected to be ready to pitch in the big leagues around June 1.
